attributes.action: Increase NHS and science research funding by £350 million per week
attributes.background: The leave campaign promised to redirect the money spent on EU membership to UK priorities, such as NHS and science funding. They should honour this promise, and increase funding for the NHS and science research by £350 million per week, which is what is spent by the UK on EU membership.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.voteleavetakecontrol.org/campaign - evidence that voters were promised increased funding for the NHS and science research by the leave campaign.

attributes.action: Referendum on making London a principality with right to remain in the EU
attributes.background: Following the overwhelming support from London voters for the UK to remain in the EU, we request that HM Government consider the option to allow London (as a principality of the U.K.) to remain in the EU - if necessary, following a second referendum/London-only vote.

attributes.action: Make London, Northern Ireland and Scotland an independent EU state.
attributes.background: The Majority of Scotland, Northern Ireland and London have voted to remain in the UK. So I ask Parliament to hold a referendum to make London Northern Ireland and Scotland a separate state of the European Union.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence as per EU Referendum results in press.

attributes.action: Allow the area within the M25 to secede from the UK and remain part of the EU.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe the results of the EU referendum highlight irreconcilable differences between those living within the M25 and those outside of it.  Accordingly, we wish to secede from the UK so that we can have our (sane) vote to remain part of the EU respected.
attributes.additional_details: We invite those areas of the UK that voted to remain to join us and become part of a new commonwealth of the enlightened.

attributes.action: Create new Special Economic Zone for London, NI & Scotland which remains in EU
attributes.background: Although a majority of the UK voted to leave the EU a large majority of those in London, NI and Scotland voted to remain. These areas will suffer the most from the UK leaving the EU. Special Economic Zones have been created in many countries, including China, with much success.
attributes.additional_details:
We know the EU isn't perfect and needs radical reform but for many in the UK that doesn't mean we should leave it. This petition requests that the creation of a Special Economic Zone is discussed in Parliament. This Zone would remain a member of the EU and contain London, and perhaps other interested contiguous regions.

This SEZ would enable these regions to continue trading from within the EU thereby fostering increased trade, investment and job creation.

attributes.action: Bristol to receive a referendum to leave the UK and form an independent Nation
attributes.background: After vote leave won we believe that the United Kingdom does not speak or represent Bristol anymore and believe it better to move in a different direction from the UK

attributes.action: Call for an enquiry into false claims & advertising used in the EU Referendum
attributes.background: Both sides used false advertising and claims during the EU Referendum. It made for a completely confusing debate and made it extremely hard for the electorate to follow, and therefore tough to make an informed decision.

attributes.action: A referendum for Independence for London, and the South East England Counties.
attributes.background: On the 23rd of June 2016 the United Kingdom voted to leave the EU. London & South East of England thrive on European trade and intrinsic links to global wealth and trade that it brings.
attributes.additional_details: On the 23rd of June 2016 the United Kingdom held a referendum to on Europe. The local economies of "L&SE" (London and the South East) are driven by our intrinsic links to global trade and global wealth, and services to be provided around this. The EU is a vital component of these links.

attributes.action: Hand the same £100 on the spot fine to cyclists without a helmet.
attributes.background: Motorists are given an on the spot fine for not wearing a seatbelt.  There is no reason this should not be imposed upon a cyclist on a cycle without head protection.
attributes.additional_details: There are already many changes in cyclists favour. Prioritised junctions, Left turn bans, Stricter lgv regulations, mirrors at junctions, but still day after day they dart around without safety equipment. More responsibility should be put on them.

attributes.action: A referendum to Vote Scotland out of the U.K.
attributes.background: Scotland had their Referendum to be independent. The SNP want to Remain in the EU against the will of English and Welsh voters. Therefore I believe England, Wales and Northern Ireland should get the chance to have their Referendum to vote Scotland out of the U.K.

attributes.action: When a minor offence becomes 'spent', remove it from a person's enhanced DBS.
attributes.background: When I was young, I got into trouble with the police which resulted in a criminal record; these were minor offences. All my convictions are now spent but they still show up on an enhanced DBS check which makes it difficult to find alternative employment.We shouldn't be judged by juvenile mistakes.
attributes.additional_details: After a search online, it became apparent that this issue is common. There are many skilled and qualified people who are more than capable of doing there job but employers won't take the risk because of a document which states information from 5, 10, 15 even 30 years ago.

attributes.action: Introduce retrospective legislation offering protection to company pension funds
attributes.background: Philip Green purchased BHS in 2000. Since then he has reportedly extracted £580M from the company, driving it to bankruptcy. Meanwhile there is a £571M shortfall in the pension fund affecting thousands of workers. This is a morally reprehensible situation that should be rectified.

attributes.action: Create a separate loan that caters for accommodation for university students
attributes.background: Many student loans barely cover the cost of accommodation, so how will students from low income families go to the university of their choice when accommodation is more than the loan they are entitled to? This leaves many students in a deficit before they've even paid for anything.
attributes.additional_details: With an extra loan that caters for accommodation students will not have debt on their shoulders as soon as they start university, and can start focusing on more important things like the education itself. If grants are scrapped, at least bring something new and realistic to the table? This way less students will be tied between going to university or not because of the expenses, and will have easier access to a higher education letting students from 'low income families' have a better chance.

attributes.action: To introduce lessons on taxation and British law into the national curriculum.
attributes.background: I believe that as a student who will soon be making the change to university life hopefully, I and many others are under prepared for adult life. I also believe that it is vital children know their rights as a British citizen and also the basic laws of Britain.

attributes.action: Send all foreign prisoners back to their countries of origin and ban them.
attributes.background: We have seen on recent BBC news programmes that the UK prison service is in a dire straight. Lack of funding, violent and dangerous it is another failing part of the UK.  Foreign criminals, many from the EU now make up a significant part of the UK inmates and are costing us a fortune.

attributes.action: Introduce realistic maximum time for DBS applications for people trying to work.
attributes.background: DBS disclosures are needed to protect vulnerable people, yet thousands of people with families are waiting months to start a job they have been offered. This causes detrimental effects to peoples health and well being and in some cases homelessness.
attributes.additional_details:
These stresses and strains caused to peoples livelihoods need to be dramatically reduced. Many people are waiting over 5 months (in some cases over 7) uncertain of when they can financially support themselves and their families.
Many applications made to the DBS are for roles within the health and social care sector, increasingly under pressure through lack of staff. 
The government should also consider that such delays in peoples wages also directly impacts upon income tax payments.

attributes.action: Parliament to change the law, on Section 75 Credit Act to apply on debit cards.
attributes.background: A petition calling on Parliament to change the law, so that Section 75 of the Consumer Credit Act applies to debit cards in the same way that it applies to credit cards.
attributes.additional_details:
MAKE BANKS TO REFUND CHARGEBACK TO SMALL BUSINESS VICTIMS OF FRAUD.

Bank don’t pay chargeback on a debit card, fraud is no legal obligation as in Section 75 with Credit Cards. As a small business sole trader I became a victim of fraud losing £4271.39 to a supplier in Holland.

I wrote to Action fraud, the British police, the Dutch police, the Dutch embassy in London still no one can help, I went to the citizen advice, and even my MP tried to help but dead end. I believe banks should consider and realise how small businesses are affected by fraudsters and chargeback accordingly to exceptional circumstances. It is unbelievable that in such according to my experience no one is helping.

attributes.action: Petrol stations must offer the option to purchase fuel with a CO2 offset eg +1p
attributes.background: Driving my car contributes to global warming because burning fuel produces CO2. I would happily choose to pay an extra penny or so to offset my carbon, for example, by planting a tree. We will empower every driver to make a difference and show that Britain can lead the world in CO2 reduction.
attributes.additional_details:
It is very difficult for ordinary people to reduce the amount of CO2 that they produce. I have to heat my house in winter, drive to work and I like to go on holiday somewhere warm. Although I can reduce my consumption a bit, I can't reduce it enough to make a difference on my own. However if I work with other people I can make a difference.

 "Carbon offsetting" allows me to pay other people to reduce their CO2 emissions and "offset" my own. Here are some examples of offsetting projects https://www.bptargetneutral.com/uk/our-projects/a-global-portfolio/

attributes.action: Exemption of the 3% tax levy on parents helping their children to buy a home.
attributes.background: Helping children to buy homes should not be taxed. The money being used by parents has already been taxed twice as salary and as savings. This law is morally corrupt.

attributes.action: Stop increasing the pension age.  Reverse it back to 62 and 67 now.
attributes.background: Action is urgently required.  there are few of us who feel able to work in their late 60's/mid 70's especially if their jobs have been stressful or physical.  Just how are we supposed to keep going and who is going to employ us.  Reverse this increase back to 62 and 67 now

attributes.action: Make an INDEPENDENT EU booklet - facts, figures, forecasts if we STAY + if we GO
attributes.background: The EU Referendum is producing a blizzard of numbers, claims, guesses - it is virtually impossible for voters to assess properly the facts as they stand, or to get a balanced set of forecasts on the implications of either result. Without this information, the public cannot be asked to make a choice.
attributes.additional_details:
An independently produced booklet, perhaps no bigger the governments already produced booklet on why we should vote to stay, can be quickly produced to present first the facts as they stand and then the general expert views on what are the implications for the country if we vote to stay and if we vote to go.
Without giving voters a proper opportunity to assess both the facts and the body of opinion for both options in order to make their informed choice, we undermine democracy itself.

attributes.action: Provide the Queen and Country with a New Royal Yacht
attributes.background: I have always believed that Britannia should have been replaced. It was always more than just a Royal Residence. It was a vessel that sailed the World and was a great example of what made and makes the UK great.

attributes.action: stop medicines wastage, allow the re-use of returned medication to the  pharmacy
attributes.background: Every year millions of pounds is lost when medications are returned to the pharmacy for destruction by patients, care homes e.t.c. Some of the medication remains untouched. We have the ridiculous situation where medication that has left the premises and returned the next day has to be destroyed.
attributes.additional_details: The government should allow pharmaceutical bodies to have criteria which can be followed to allow some medication that has to be returned to pharmacies to be re-used thus saving millions of pounds firstly in destruction costs and secondly in the cost of the medication. In light of the recent financial crisis and the cash strapped NHS. These efficiency savings could be pumped back into the NHS. It is also and unethical scenario when there are people around the globe who cannot afford medications.

attributes.action: Scrap the proposed tax on individual landlords with mortgages
attributes.background: I have worked all my life and  do not have a pension (like George Osbourne), I bought a small property for the future so I wont be a burden on the state.
attributes.additional_details: I know everyone will think all landlords are rich but we simply are not Im just trying to provide an income for when I retire in about ten years and don't think I should be punished for this.

attributes.action: Make all military veterans pensions tax free after a minimum service period
attributes.background: All veterans currently pay income tax on their pensions after full active military service i.e 22 years.  This is then classed as a second income, and other job income taxed accordingly.

attributes.action: Support farmers,pay rural farm payments on time.
attributes.background: This badly organised system has caused suicide within the farming community,disrupting cash flow.
attributes.additional_details: Payment on time: farmers are the salt of the earth:why do we have to suffer, the worry of not being able to pay our debts,last minute decision to inform us: no information as to when payments will be made.Try to get any answers is impossible:

attributes.action: All police forces and MPs have drug tests every 3 months
attributes.background: Both parties hold high responsibility jobs, If the public can be penalised for it, then so can police forces and MPs, what's good for the goose is good for the gander

attributes.action: Scrap the £9000 tuiton fees!
attributes.background: Students on majority of course are now forced to pay £9000 a year to go and study for their career, a 3/4 year course leaves students with £36,000 debt before their career has even started! Lets fight against this! Many student do even get theres moneys worth or the services they paid for.
attributes.additional_details: The fees for university were £1000 in 1998...how times have changed how can you justify £9000 today?

attributes.action: Teach Creationism (Bible) as a Fact in all State and Academy Schools
attributes.background: This petition is saying that the fact of Biblical creationism should be compulsory in all state and academy schools, and for it to be taught as the fact.
attributes.additional_details: Genesis, which was written around 1,500 BC in the Bible is the truth of God's word, as written by Moses from God's instructions. If we really want to keep the United Kingdom a Christian nation, rather than an atheist nation, we must teach compulsive Creationism in all schools across the UK.

attributes.action: Raise the lifetime ISA upper age limit from 40 to 45.
attributes.background: The 40 year upper limit for the new life time ISA is too low. People upto the age of 45 should have this opportunity as well.

attributes.action: Stop schools forcing children to pray and sing religious songs in assembly.
attributes.background: It is not fair that children, in Primary Schools especially are forced to sing religious songs, hear biblical stories and say prayer in morning assemblies. Even if children are allowed to sit out (e.g. because they have different beliefs) that is encouraging isolation based on religion.

attributes.action: Reject the PM's deal: put an option in the referendum to demand a democratic EU.
attributes.background: The PM's deal makes the EU nor more democratic and returns no sovereignty to the 28 states. We must be able to elect EU legislators and executive and be able to remove them. Others of the 28 states within the EU are demanding more democracy and an end to the secret deals struck between bureaucrats.
attributes.additional_details: You might see the DiEM25 site (http://diem25.org) and read some of Yanis Veroufakis' posts for some informative data.  It is not necessary to agree with the solutions, but only to understand the problems.

attributes.action: Make the selling of electronic devices with pre-installed malware/adware illegal
attributes.background: A lot of low-end tablets and phones come with pre-installed malware and ad-ware that is a big security risk for the user, normally it is also not possible to remove these

attributes.action: Revise the Protection from Harassment Act 1997
attributes.background:
The harassment Act is one incredibly washy piece of legislation which allows the Police to apply the act to almost any situation. 

There is clearly a need & public interest in preventing harassment especially where violence or a threat of violence is involved. 
It is not proportionate at present
attributes.additional_details:
The act needs to exempt online and digital communications as there is clearly technology to get around this contact.
The act needs to allow for non threatening contact and not criminalise civil disputes.

attributes.action: By LAW, owners of micro-chipped pets change the details as with a car log book.
attributes.background: Too many owners are getting away with animal abuse. They are stating, when RSPCA/ police knock on their door, they "sold it on" or "only bred it". Therefore responsibility has gone. A car is a lump of metal but people are fined if the log book is not changed over to the new owner.
attributes.additional_details: Therefore responsibility has gone. A car is a lump of metal but people are fined if the log book is not changed over to the new owner. The same law needs to be applied to chipped pets. If you sell/give away a pet then you are responsible for obtaining the new owners details, the same as selling a car on. If not, YOU are liable.  Proof of address is all is needed, passport etc. It is not hard! This now needs to be the next stage in making people responsible for their pets and liable if any harm comes to them if you have not taken the correct steps when your pet goes to a new home.  This WILL stop further animal abuse.

attributes.action: Apprenticeships; Stop loss of child related benefits for low income families.
attributes.background: The search for my future career has come to me and I was searching for options for my post 16 education. One option that came to mind was an apprenticeship. However, being from a low income family it soon became apparent that there were great financial implications rendering me unable to do one.
attributes.additional_details: Apprentices even though they are classed as in training they are no longer classed as 'dependants' for child tax credit and child benefit reasons thus leaving families a shortfall of in some cases upward of £80; a sum of which families below a certain income cannot afford to loose.

attributes.action: Move Parliament to a central UK location during building repairs at Westminster.
attributes.background: London-centric investment and thinking dominates at the expense of the rest of the UK. The political establishment, and the nation, would benefit immensely from having a more geographically central view point, if only temporarily for the duration of Houses of Parliament building works.
attributes.additional_details:
Renovating the Houses of Parliament with Commons and Lords in occupation will be costly beyond belief.
Historically Parliament often moved.
Germany has coped well with moving the Bundestag first to Bonn, and then back to Berlin.
Today's (16 February 2016) news of the closing of Bede's World museum in Jarrow is just the latest indication of the dominance of London and the South East and the reinforcement of the North-South divide.

attributes.action: Make ministers do work experience in all the jobs covered by their departments.
attributes.background: People who actually do the work - eg: teaching, fishing, being creative - have real insight into what works and what doesn't work. Let's our ministers that hands on experience and set of real relationships.  Then perhaps they would make wiser policy decisions which work with people and our values.
attributes.additional_details: I work supporting people with learning disabilities and their families.  Government financial policy is undermining our ability to support people properly giving them dignity and human rights.  I believe that any MP who worked with people would appreciate the positive inspiration they are to others and see people as a gift not a cost.  In other sectors the whole sense of what is important and of value would change.  Our leaders would lead from lived experience rather than mental guesses.

attributes.action: Improve the salary and working conditions of Junior Doctors
attributes.background: The NHS is under threat because the current government does not appropriately recognise the needs of Junior Doctors

attributes.action: Compulsory Annual Fitness Bleep test for Members Of Parliament.
attributes.background: Recent introduction of Police Compulsory Fitness Bleep testing should naturally extend to the governing bodies the Houses Of Parliament in the order of Transparency and Equality. I offer to extend the Government's own introduction to incorporate the Members Of Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: Recent introduction of Police Compulsory Fitness Bleep testing should naturally extend to the governing bodies the Houses Of Parliament in the order of Transparency and Equality. I offer to extend the Government's own introduction to incorporate the Members Of Parliament.

attributes.action: Make law/part of MOT high viz vests first aid kit and fire extinguisher in cars.
attributes.background: It should be law and part of the MOT that every car should carry high visibility vests 1 per seat as well as a first aid kit and fire extinguisher. Also that no matter what time of the day or night if you break down you must wear the vest. Might just save quite a few lives even one.

attributes.action: Seek an EU deal where migrant worker benefit costs are met by their home state.
attributes.background: David Cameron should change tack on his negotiation with the EU over EU-migrant benefits and push for a deal which allows the free movement of workers, a core EU principle, but stipulates that the cost of any benefits for those workers be paid for by the state from which that person originates.
attributes.additional_details: e.g. a Polish worker in the UK would be entitled to benefits under Polish and UK law, but would be paid for by the Polish state. Likewise any UK person living in Spain, for example, who is entitled to claim benefits would have the cost of those met by the UK government.

attributes.action: Work with major chains to ban non-recyclable coffee cups ending up in landfill
attributes.background: In the UK over 2.5 billion take-away coffee cups are placed in landfill every year. The public are wrongly led to believe that these cups are actually recyclable (i.e. through environment friendly logos on the packaging). This is a major issue resulting in huge amounts of waste
attributes.additional_details:
'A conservative estimate puts the number of paper cups handed out by coffee shops in the UK at 3bn, more than 8m a day. Yet, supposedly, fewer than one in 400 is being recycled'.

I propose that the Government actively works with major coffee chains and retailers to explore the use of environmentally friendly coffee cups. As part of this, non-recyclable cups should be banned or a tax placed on them to encourage the use of 'cups for life' and bringing in a national awareness of the problem.

attributes.action: Change law so a learner can ride a 250cc motorcycle once passed car test or CBT.
attributes.background:
Please change the law for learner motorcycle riders.
Please change from 125cc to 250cc for learner riders. 
Many accidents happen due to mopeds having small wheels.
It's pretty easy for the front wheel to slip away on a corner. Bikes with larger wheel don't usually have this problem.
attributes.additional_details:
This would also help the environment as 4stroke engines would be available. These are much cleaner with less pollutants entering the atmosphere.
If publicised right it could mean less cars on the already busy roads.

attributes.action: Make it law for individuals to return footballs if they land on their property
attributes.background: 1000's of footballs are held hostage each year by individuals who assume rights to the ball once it lands on their property. As parents of a very keen footballer, this has cost us a small fortune over the years and we would like to ask government to address this very hazy and unclear subject.

attributes.action: Road works on motorways should require 24/7 working.
attributes.background: Road works on motorways and major public roads should have 24/7 working to reduce loss of trade to local business and increased inconvenience to the UK population. The UK will be globally more effective and prosperous if the UK's transport links are more efficient.
attributes.additional_details: A short term pain, will lead to a long term gain.

attributes.action: Save the Battle of Britain display at the Royal Aircraft Museum.
attributes.background: While at the RAF Museum I saw that many of the exhibits in the Battle of Britain Hall were being dismantled.  It appears the BoB Museum will be no more and the aircraft therein will be dispersed, either to areas within the Hendon site, RAF Cosford or put in storage.

attributes.action: stop the WPD from making radical changes to existing final salary schemes
attributes.background: All existing final salary schemes were signed  by the individual and the company after full explanation of the contents and should be legally binding .They should not be able to be manipulated by Ministers or the Work and Pensions department years later .

attributes.action: I'd like Narcissistic Abuse and Covert Bullying to be recognised as an offense
attributes.background: Narcissistic Abuse and Covert Bullying needs to be recognised as a crime. The victim is often left feeling helpless and controlled. Narcissists are sneaky and will attack while hiding behind others (to guard their reputation). Its a form of bullying which includes smear campaigns and 'gaslighting'
attributes.additional_details:
The definition of 'victim' is A person who is tricked or duped or A person who has come to feel helpless and passive in the face of misfortune or ill treatment.

Narcissists trick their victim, getting a thrill from manipulating them and making fools of them. If the victim retaliates, the narcissist will unleash a smear campaign, ruining that persons reputation. Its a form of covert bullying, which leaves lifes and careers in tatters. Narcissistic abuse can happen anywhere and is soul destroying

attributes.action: Introduce PR to resolve the deep divisions created by the EU referendum.
attributes.background: Self-explanatory
attributes.additional_details: The referendum demanded a single answer to a complex question, was unbalanced in terms of outcome (one being final) and was decided by a narrow margin.
